{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pulp mummification is a procedure used to preserve the vitality of the pulp in certain situations. Let's evaluate each option:

A. Non-vital tooth: Pulp mummification is not indicated in a non-vital tooth because the pulp is already necrotic.

B. Deep caries on a symptomatic vital tooth: Pulp mummification is not indicated in this case because the tooth is symptomatic, indicating that the pulp is already compromised.

C. Traumatic exposure of a vital tooth: Pulp mummification can be indicated in this case to preserve the vitality of the pulp and promote healing.

D. Traumatic exposure of a vital tooth with open wide apex: Pulp mummification is indicated in this case to preserve the vitality of the pulp and promote healing, especially if the apex is open and the tooth is not fully developed.", "answer_choice": "C/D"}
